bt: Results: The mean values for the total duration (9.54 ms), polyphase, number of phases (3.6) and taglia index (0.67) in the cases of cervical injury were significantly P.

src: Bariatric surgery is an important option when life-style modification, diet, and medical treatment are inadequate in lose weight. Bariatric surgical methods have gained popularity in recent years. In this paper, we compared the Magenstrasse and Mill(M&M) technique, with performing a simpler and more physiological type of gastroplasty without implanted foreign material such as band and reservoir, to the Sleeve Gastrectomy (SG) technique.
bt: Bariatric surgery is an important option when lifestyle changes, diet and medical treatment are inadequate to lose weight.Bariatric surgical methods have gained popularity in recent years.In this article, we have compared the Magenstrasse and Mill (M&M) technique with the execution of a simpler and physiological type of gastroplastic without foreign material implanted as a bandage and tank, with the Sleeve Gastrectomy (SG) technique.

src: This study aimed to determine the effects of the M&M for obesity on the rabbits in comparison with the SG, which is accepted as a standard bariatric technique with creating a gastric tube. The study was approved by the University of Van Yuzuncu Yıl Regional Committee of Ethics (Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee). 20New Zealand Rabbits underwent operations.
bt: This study aimed to determine the effects of M & M on rabbit obesity compared to SG, which was accepted as a standard bariatric technique with the creation of a gastric tube.The study was approved by the University of Van Yuzuncu's Regional Ethics Committee (IUCN).20 New Zealand rabbits were operated on.

src: After prestudy with 2 rabbits, the remaining 18 rabbits were divided into 2 groups; Group 1 (SG) and Group 2 (M&M). Group 1 rabbits were observed to lose weight in all, while Group 2 rabbits;
bt: After the preliminary study with 2 rabbits, the remaining 18 rabbits were divided into 2 groups; Group 1 (SG) and Group 2 (M&M).In rabbits of Group 1 a total weight loss was observed, while in rabbits of Group 2 a total weight loss was observed;

src: 2 of them died, 5 of them lost weight, 2 of them gained weight. When the pre and post-operative weight of the rabbits were compared; preoperative median weight values of 9 rabbits in Group 1 were significantly higher than postoperative values. On the other hand, there was no significant change in the mean weight of Group 2 of 7 rabbits (living up to 8weeks).
bt: When the pre- and post-operative weight of the rabbits were compared, the median pre-operative weight values of nine rabbits in Group 1 were significantly higher than the post-operative values; on the other hand, there was no significant change in the mean weight of the group 2 of seven rabbits (living up to 8 weeks).

src: The mean weight of rabbits undergoing standard SG was significantly lower than the M&M technique. We believe that this animal experimental study, which we conducted intending to compare M&M and SG techniques, will contribute to the literature as a pilot study and determine the survey of M&M technique as a pioneer in other studies. Bariatric surgery, Magenstrasse and Mill gastroplasty, Sleeve gastrectomy.
bt: The average weight of the standard SG-treated rabbits was significantly lower than the M&M technique. We believe that this experimental study on animals, which we conducted with the intention of comparing the M&M and SG techniques, will contribute to the literature as a pilot study and will determine the investigation of the M&M technique as a pioneer in other studies.

src: Monitoring of Porcine Reproductive and Respiratory Syndrome Virus (PRRSV) in pig farms is performed usually by testing for antibodies against PRRSV in serum samples. A new method is the detection of PRRSV antibodies in porcine saliva. In this study serum samples and saliva were collected in nine farms suspicious for PRRSV and tested for the presence of PRRSV antibodies.
bt: Monitoring of the virus of the reproductive and respiratory syndrome of pigs (PRRSV) in pig farms is usually performed by testing for antibodies to PRRSV in serum samples.A new method is the detection of PRRSV antibodies in pig saliva.In this study, serum and saliva samples were collected from nine farms suspected of PRRSV and tested for anti-PRRSV antibodies.

src: In total 220 serum and 41 saliva samples were taken from pigs at the age of 8 weeks (± 1 week). One saliva and one pooled serum sample (1:5) were tested from each pen. In total 11 (Cut-off 0.4/0.3) or 14 (Cut-off 0.2) serum samples and 23 saliva out of 41 pens were positive for PRRSV antibodies.
bt: In total 220 serum samples and 41 saliva samples were taken from pigs aged 8 weeks (± 1 week).For each penna, one saliva and one aggregate serum sample (1:5).In total 11 (cut-off 0.4/0.3) or 14 (cut-off 0.2) samples of serum and 23 saliva samples per 41 penna were tested positive for PRRSV antibodies.

src: Cohen`s Kappa testing showed a moderate agreement (κ = 0.446). Saliva samples compared to pooled serum samples were very sensitive, the specificity was 60 and 67, respectively.
bt: The Cohen Kappa test showed a moderate concordance (= 0.446).The saliva samples, compared to the serum samples in the pool, were very sensitive, with a specificity of 60 and 67, respectively.

src: Objective: In 2012, the Reassessment Campaign on Veterinary Resuscitation (RECOVER) published the first evidence-based small animal CPR guidelines. Even though a RECOVER-based CPR approach has been shown to improve patient outcomes, guideline awareness and compliance is necessary to see such benefits. Our study aimed to characterize Swiss small animal veterinary CPR practices and assess their compliance with RECOVER guidelines.
bt: Objective: In 2012, the Reassessment Campaign on Veterinary Resuscitation (RECOVER) published the first evidence-based guidelines for RCP in small animals.Although it has been shown that a RECOVER approach to CPR improves patient outcomes, awareness and compliance with guidelines are necessary to see these benefits.Our study aimed to characterize the practices of Swiss veterinary RCP for small animals and to assess compliance with RECOVER guidelines.

src: Methods: A nationwide, internet-based survey was conducted, and invitations distributed via Swiss veterinary society mailing lists. Questions covered respondents' demographics, CPR preparedness, Basic Life Support (BLS) and Advanced Life Support (ALS) techniques, and awareness of RECOVER guidelines. Percentages of group total (95% confidence interval) were calculated.
bt: Methods: A national Internet survey was conducted and invitations were distributed via a mailing list of Swiss veterinary companies.The questions related to the demographics of the interviewees, preparation for the RCP, basic life support techniques (BLS) and advanced life support techniques (ALS) and awareness of the RECUPERO guidelines.The percentages of the total group (confidence range to 95%) were calculated.

src: Results: One-hundred and fifty respondents were grouped by level of expertise into board-certified specialists (BCS, n = 19), veterinarians with additional post-graduate training (PGT, n = 27), and general practitioners with (GPE, n = 30), and without emergency duties (GPG, n = 74). Of BCS respondents, 58% (36-77%) were familiar with the RECOVER guidelines, compared to 8% (4-17%) of GPG. Large disparities in preparedness, BLS, and ALS techniques emerged among the levels of expertise.
bt: Results: one hundred and fifty respondents were grouped by level of competence in board certified specialists (BCS, n = 19), veterinarians with additional post-graduate training (PGT, n = 27) and general practitioners with (GPE, n = 30), and without emergency competitions (GPG, n = 74).Among the participants in the BCS questionnaire, 58% (36-77%) were familiar with the RECOVER guideline, compared to 8% (4-17%) of GPGs.

src: Incompliance with preparedness measures varied from 89% (69-98%) in BCS to 100% (95-100%) in GPG and was predominantly due to failure to attend regular CPR training. BLS compliance ranged from 26% (12-49%) in BCS to 5% (2-13%) in GPG, and incompliance was mostly characterized by targeting lower than recommended chest compression rates. ALS compliance varied from 21% (9-43%) in BCS to 0% (0-5%) in GPG and was compromised by limitations in the resuscitation environment such as lacking access to a defibrillator, monitoring equipment, and rescue drugs.
bt: Compliance with the preparation measures ranged from 89% (69-98%) in the BCS to 100% (95-100%) in the GPG and was mainly due to the inability to attend regular training for CPR. Compliance with the BLS ranged from 26% (12-49%) in the BCS to 5% (2-13%) in the GPG, and the non-compliance was mostly characterized by targeting lower than recommended rates of chest compression. Compliance with the SLA ranged from 21% (9-43%) in the BCS 0% (0-5%) in the GPG and was compromised by limitations in the resuscitation environment, such as lack of access to a defibrillator, monitoring equipment and emergency pharmacies.

src: Conclusion: Awareness of RECOVER guidelines in Switzerland is acceptable in specialists, but inadequate among general practitioners and CPR practices are largely not in agreement with RECOVER guidelines. An educational strategy is needed to improve Swiss small animal CPR knowledge and performance.
bt: Conclusions: awareness of the RECOVER guidelines in Switzerland is acceptable among specialists, but inadequate among primary care physicians and the practice of RECOVER is largely inconsistent with the RECOVER guidelines.An educational strategy is needed to improve the knowledge and performance of the Swiss RECOVER for small animals.

src: The aim of this study was to quantify the impact of radiologic image review performed by experienced radiologists in a multidisciplinary team (MDT) for head and neck cancers (HNCs). We performed a retrospective review of cases discussed at MDT meetings from April 2014 to March 2017 for which radiologic review was required. All changes in the former radiologic report were collected and classified as follows: 1) modifications of radiological reports (patients for whom the treatment strategy had not been defined at the moment of MDT meeting) and 2) modifications in treatment strategy (patients for whom treatment strategy had previously been defined and subsequently modified according to the outcome of radiologic revision).
bt: The purpose of this study was to quantify the impact of the revision of radiological images performed by expert radiologists in a multidisciplinary team (MDT) for head and neck tumors (HNC).We conducted a retrospective review of the cases discussed at MDT meetings from April 2014 to March 2017 for which a radiological review was required.All the modifications to the previous radiological report were collected and classified as follows: 1) modifications to the radiological reports (patients for whom the treatment strategy was not defined at the time of the MDT meeting) and 2) modifications to the treatment strategy (patients for whom the treatment strategy was previously defined and subsequently modified based on all the results of the radiological review).

src: The latter subgroup was further categorised as “major changes” and as “minor changes”. A total of 540 cases were retrieved. Imaging review was required at the time of tumour diagnosis in 310 (57.4%) cases.
bt: The latter subgroup was further classified as "modification major" and "modification minor".A total of 540 cases were recovered.In 310 (57.4%) cases an imaging examination was required at the time of the tumor diagnosis.

src: Most patients (69%) had advanced stage tumours (III and IV). In 262 (48%) cases, no change of the initial radiologic report was made. In a total of 144 (27%) cases, the available imaging was not considered sufficient for a final indication to treatment and further imaging was required.
bt: In 262 cases (48%) no change was made to the initial radiological ratio; in a total of 144 (27%) cases, the diagnosis per available image was not considered sufficient for a definitive indication of treatment and further diagnosis per image was required.

src: In the remaining 134 (25%) cases, radiologic review led to a modification of either tumour staging (55%) or treatment strategy (45%). Specifically, major and minor modifications were applied in 44 (13%) and 17 (11%) of the cases considered, respectively. Among 134 patients for whom the radiologic review led to stage/treatment modification, follow-up was available for 118.
bt: In the remaining 134 (25%) cases, radiological review resulted in a change in the stage of the tumor (55%) or treatment strategy (45%).In particular, major and minor changes were applied in 44 (13%) and 17 (11%) of the cases considered, respectively.Of the 134 patients for whom radiological review resulted in a change in the stage/treatment, follow-up was available for 118.

src: In all but one patient, we could confirm the original reports were correctly modified per MDT discussion results. Our data strongly support the importance of including an experienced radiologist as a core member of the MDT for HNCs.
bt: In all but one patient, we were able to confirm that the original reports had been correctly modified based on the results of the MDT discussion.Our data strongly support the importance of including an experienced radiologist as a central member of the MDT for HNC.

src: The publication of J. J. Wirth's layman's handbook to healthier cattle farming practices in 1842 met with such unexpected demand even beyond the Canton of Grisons, that a second revised and updated edition was published by one of his successors in the charge of -cantonal veterinary officer, J. L. Wallraff, twenty years later. Through the analysis of these two mid-nineteenth century editions, one can observe how farming and herding practices changed in the Grisons, as concerns the developments in veterinary practices by both -professionals and laypersons in the treatment and prevention of injury, illness and disease in livestock. A comparison of the two editions demonstrates what -remarkable advancements in veterinary medicine were made in the mountainous Canton of Grisons in the second half of the 19th century, especially concerning epidemic controls within a short twenty-year span.
bt: The publication of J.J. Wirth's manual on the practices of raising healthier livestock in 1842 met such an unexpected demand beyond the Canton of Grigioni, that a second, revised and updated edition was published by one of its successors, J.L. Wallraff, twenty years later.Through the analysis of these two mid-19th century editions, one can observe how agricultural and pastoral practices in Grigioni have changed, with regard to developments in veterinary practices by professionals and laypeople in the treatment and prevention of injury, disease and disease in animals.A comparison of the due qualities of the disease shows that progressive epidemiological controls in Canton of Grigioni in the second half of the 19th century have been compiled in a brief twenty-year period, in particular with regard to the control of epidemics in the second half of the 19th century.

src: Creatine kinase (CK) is a muscle enzyme that is very sensitive to muscle damage. Therefore, serum CK is measured particularly to confirm suspected myopathy. Since 2013, this enzyme has been included in the routine chemistry profile in our hospital.
bt: Creatine chinase (CK) is a muscle enzyme that is very sensitive to muscle damage, and therefore, the CK is measured specifically to confirm a suspected myopathy, and since 2013 this enzyme has been included in the routine chemical profile of our hospital.

src: Soon thereafter, the subjective impression developed that its elevation did not correlate to and was not explainable with the actual clinical problem. Therefore, the aim of this retrospective study was to investigate in which clinical cases the CK elevation was adequate and in which cases without clinical evidence of muscle damage the CK was so markedly elevated that it implied a clinically relevant muscle damage. For this purpose, we evaluated the CK values of 1641 cats presented in the years 2013/2014 at our university animal hospital.
bt: Shortly thereafter, the subjective impression developed that its elevation was not correlated with the actual clinical problem and could not be explained.The purpose of this retrospective study was therefore to investigate in which clinical cases the elevation of the CK was adequate and in which cases, without clinical evidence of muscle damage, the CK was so markedly elevated as to imply a clinically relevant muscle damage.

src: The CK was comprehensibly elevated in cats with trauma and various diseases with obvious and traceable muscle damage like thrombo-embolic damage or seizures. In addition, the CK was elevated in diseases where concomitant muscle damage is perceivable like in cats with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. However, the CK also was commonly and sometimes dramatically elevated in cats of essentially any disease group without any comprehensible skeletal muscular lesion.
bt: CK was understandably elevated in cats with trauma and various diseases with obvious and traceable muscle damage such as thromboembolic damage or seizures, and CK was also a high result in diseases where concomitant muscle damage was perceived, such as in cats with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, but CK was also commonly and sometimes significantly elevated in cats of virtually any group of diseases without any muscle and skeletal muscle damage understandable.

src: These results confirm the hypothesis that the diagnostic value of this parameter is most questionable. A CK elevation does not allow any conclusion regarding its original diagnostic purpose, i.e. to confirm the presence of a clinically relevant myopathy.
bt: These results confirm the hypothesis that the diagnostic value of this parameter is highly questionable, and an increase in CK does not allow conclusions to be drawn about its original diagnostic purpose, namely to confirm the presence of a clinically relevant myopathy.

src: This article provides an African American-Native American analyst-in-training's first-hand reflections on Jung's firm depiction of Blacks of African descent and America's First Nations People (the Red man) as inferior, through a theory of primitivity that unveils Jung's belief in and support of White supremacy. With no intended disrespect or neglect intended toward America's First Nations, this article focuses primarily on Jung's apparent disdain for Blacks (the Negro). Utilizing writings from Frederick Douglass, W.E.B.
bt: This article provides the first-hand reflections of an African-American-American analyst in training on Jung's firm portrayal of blacks of African descent and the people of the American First Nations (the red man) as inferior, through a theory of primitivity that reveals Jung's faith and support for white supremacy.Without any lack of respect or neglect towards the American First Nations, this article focuses primarily on Jung's apparent disdain for the blacks.

src: Du Bois and Na'im Akbar, this article highlights ways in which Jung's biases align with the White supremacist perspective of the Negro as a problem, detrimental to social order. The paper concludes with an Appendix which outlines a call to the International Association for Analytical Psychology (IAAP) to take corrective action and to publicly denounce those facets of Jung's writings that diverge from the core of his theory and that promote toxic attitudes of bigotry, perhaps discouraging many people of colour from enrolling in analytic training.
bt: Du Bois and Na'im Akbar, this article highlights the ways in which Jung's prejudices aligned with the white supremacist perspective of black as a problem, harmful to the social order.The paper concludes with an appendix in which it asks the International Association of Analytical Psychology (IAAP) to take corrective action and publicly denounce those aspects of Jung's writings that deviate from the core of his theory and promote toxic attitudes of bigotry, perhaps discouraging many people of color from enrolling in analytical training.

src: Cardiopulmonary arrest (CPA) is the acute cessation of systemic perfusion and ventilation. It leads to a lack of tissue oxygen delivery and, if not addressed quickly, will inevitably cause death. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) is the only available treatment for CPA and several opportunities exist to improve the veterinary team's resuscitation approach and optimize small animal CPR patient outcomes.
bt: Cardiopolmonary arrest (CPA) is the acute cessation of systemic perfusion and ventilation.It leads to a lack of oxygen in the tissues and, if not addressed quickly, will inevitably cause death.Cardiopolmonary resuscitation (RCP) is the only treatment available for CPA and there are various opportunities to improve the resuscitation approach of the veterinary team and optimize the outcomes of patients with RCP on small animals.

src: In 2012, the Reassessment Campaign on Veterinary Resuscitation (RECOVER) initiative generated evidence-based clinical guidelines to form the basis for training and practice of CPR in dogs and cats. When employing an evidence-based, standardized approach to small animal CPR, return of spontaneous circulation can be achieved in up to 58% of patients and up to 7% of dogs and 19% of cats can be discharged from the veterinary hospital alive. Survival for dogs and cats that suffer CPA is best in patients that suffer a peri-anesthetic arrest, so high quality CPR in the anesthesia patient population is of utmost importance and expected to be the most rewarding.
bt: In 2012, the Reassessment Campaign on Veterinary Resuscitation (RECOVER) initiative generated evidence-based clinical guidelines to form the basis for the training and practice of CPR in dogs and cats.When a standardised, evidence-based approach is used for the cardiopulmonary resuscitation of young animals, spontaneous circulation can be restored in up to 58% of patients and up to 7% of dogs and 19% of cats can be discharged alive from the veterinary hospital.The survival rate of cats and dogs with CPA is better in patients who undergo a peri-anesthetic arrest, therefore a high-quality CPR in the population of patients undergoing extreme anesthesia is of great importance and if so, provides the most gratifying outcome.

src: To ensure the best possible outcomes for any patient suffering from CPA and undergoing CPR, a comprehensive resuscitation strategy is necessary, that includes preventive and preparedness measures, basic life support (chest compressions and ventilation), advanced life support (optimization of the patient status by targeted drug therapy, cardiac rhythm monitoring, and defibrillation), and post-cardiac arrest critical care. This article summarizes the most important RECOVER CPR guidelines for the small animal practitioner.
bt: To ensure the best possible outcomes for any CPA patient undergoing RCP, a comprehensive resuscitation strategy is needed, including preventive and preparatory measures, basic life support (breast and ventilation compression), advanced life support (optimization of patient status through targeted pharmacological therapy, monitoring of heart rate and defibrillation) and intensive post-arrest cardiac therapy. This article summarizes the most important RECOVER CPR guidelines for the professional in small animals.

src: The aim of this study is to present a case of Primary Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma of lactating left breast and after 10 years treatment in the right breast again during lactating period in a 31 years old female. Mammography showed a 4 cm lobule contoured mass in the outer quadrant of the left breast. Thorax CT showed a 42.6 mm and a few smaller nodular lesions in the middle and lower outer quadrants of the left breast and 27.3 mm diameter lymphadenopathy and smaller lymph nodes.
bt: The purpose of this study is to present a case of primary diffuse lymphoma to large B cells of the left mammella in breastfeeding and after 10 years of treatment in the right mammella again during the breastfeeding period in a 31-year-old female. mammography showed a 4 cm mass of the left mammella in the outer quadrant. chest TC showed a nodal injury of 42.6 mm and some smaller nodal lesions in the middle and lower outer quadrants of the left breast and lymphadenopathy of 27.3 mm in diameter and smaller lymph nodes.

src: In the past history of patient a mobile mass of 4 cm was found in the upper outer quadrant of the right breast during breastfeeding period after the 2nd birth at the 8th month in July 2010. Breast ultrasonography showed 37x22 mm solid lesion. Segmental mastectomy was performed for the mass (7x5x2.5 cm) at the state hospital in September 2010.
bt: In the patient's history, a 4 cm mobile mass was found in the upper external quadrant of the right mammella during the breastfeeding period after the second delivery to the 8th month in July 2010.Breast ultrasound showed a solid 37x22 mm injury.

src: The patient was diagnosed with Primary Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL), stage III. Six cycles of CHOP (cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone) and 2 cycles of monoclonal antibody rituximab were applied to the patient. In March 2011, the right chest wall was irradiated. Patient was under follow since that time.
bt: The patient was diagnosed with a primary diffuse large-cell B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL), stage III. Six cycles of CHOP (cyclofosfamide, doxorubicin, vincristine and prednisone) and two cycles of rituximab with monoclonal antibodies were applied to the patient.In March 2011, the right thoracic wall was irradiated.The patient was under control from that moment.

src: Almost 10 year later patient applied to our clinic with left breast mass again during lactating period. Mastectomy and axillary dissection were performed for local control and patient request. In pathological specimen examination, 5x4x4 cm gray a white hard mass was observed and gray-yellow lesion-like areas were observed in other areas.
bt: Almost 10 years later, the patient was again subjected to our clinic with left breast mass during the breastfeeding period.The mastectomy and ascellate dissection were performed by local control and at the patient's request.All examination of the pathological sample, a white mass and length of 5x4x4 cm and grey-grey areas similar to lesions in other areas were observed.

src: Two of 8 lymph nodes of axilla, the largest 3 cm, were found metastatic. In immunohistochemical staining, CD20, CD79a and PAX5 positive, Ki 67 70%, CD3, CD5, CyclinD1, CD10, CD30, CD99, TDT, CD38, CD1A, BCL- 2, CD34, EMA were negative. Pathological diagnosis was found primary DLBCL.
bt: Due to the 8 ascellari lymph nodes, the largest 3 cm, metastatic were found.In immunoistochemical staining, CD20, CD79a and PAX5 positive, Ki 67 70%, CD3, CD5, CyclinD1, CD10, CD30, CD99, TDT, CD38, CD1A, BCL-2, CD34, EMA were negative.The pathological diagnosis was found to be primary DLBCL.

src: The patient is currently good and receiving chemotherapy. CONCLUSION: Although bilateral primary DLBCL during breast feeding is very rare, mothers should be examined for breast mass during pregnancy and breastfeeding term. Surgery may be choice for local control of disease and supplementary radiotherapy, chemotherapy, and immunotherapy should be administered promptly following surgery.
bt: CONCLUSION: Although bilateral primary DLBCL during breastfeeding is very rare, mothers should be examined for breast mass during pregnancy and during breastfeeding.The surgery can be chosen for local disease control and radiation therapy, chemotherapy and complementary immunotherapy should be administered promptly after the procedure.

src: KEY WORDS: Bilateral, Lactating, Primary Breast Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma.
bt: Keyword: Large cell B lymphoma diffus primary, bilateral, breastfeeding.

src: Open partial horizontal laryngectomies (OPHLs) nowadays represent the first line surgical choice for the conservative treatment of locally intermediate and selected advanced stage laryngeal cancers. Among the peculiarities of OPHLs, there is the possibility of intraoperatively modulating the procedure. It would be useful for the surgeon to recognise preoperative endoscopic and radiological factors that can predict the possibility to modulate the laryngectomy.
bt: Open horizontal partial laryngectomy (OPHL) is today the first surgical choice for the conservative treatment of locally intermediate and selectively advanced laryngeal tumors.One of the peculiarities of OPHLs is the possibility of intraoperatively modulating the procedure.It would be useful for the surgeon to recognize preoperative endoscopic and radiological factors that can predict the possibility of modulating the laryngectomy.

src: The present study retrospectively reviewed a cohort of 72 patients who underwent OPHL for glottic LSCC, in order to identify preoperative (endoscopic and radiological) parameters that are able to predict modulation surgery. The hypoglottic extension of the glottic tumour was the preoperative finding that was most informative in predicting OPHL modulation. However, it had no significant impact on oncological outcomes.
bt: This study looked retrospectively at a cohort of 72 patients who underwent OPHL for glottal LSCC, in order to identify preoperative parameters (endoscopic and radiological) that could predict modulation surgery.The hypoglottic extension of the glottal tumor was the most informative preoperative data in predicting OPHL modulation.However, it did not have a significant impact on oncological outcomes.

src: Patients affected by tumours with hypoglottic extension and eligible for OPHL type II should be preoperatively informed about the possibility of an intraoperative switch towards OPHL type III.
bt: Patients with tumors with hypoglottic extension and eligible for type II OPLH should be informed prior to the procedure of the possibility of an intraoperative transition to type III OPLH.

src: The increasing professionalization and the cost pressure on farms combined with a decreasing availability of veterinary expertise procures the demand for treatments and interventions performed by non-veterinarians. A current survey resulting in 56 responses of food animal practitioners showed that a majority delivered pour-on anthelmintics, drugs for oral application and ointments after respective instruction to farmers. Udder injectors, antimicrobials and vaccines were handled more restrictively, but even hormones were committed by more than half of the veterinarians to livestock owners.
bt: The increasing professionalization and cost pressure on farms, combined with a decreased availability of veterinary expertise, are driving the demand for non-veterinary treatments and interventions to increase.A current survey, which collected 56 responses from pet operators, showed that the majority of veterinarians have administered oral, ointment and injectable anti-elmintic drugs after instructions to breeders.Injections for mammals, antimicrobials and vaccines have been used more restrictively, but even hormones have been administered by more than half of veterinarians who own livestock.

src: In respect to interventions, most practitioners supported that farmers perform functional foot trimming, administration of boli, inseminations, dehorning and castrations of calves. By contrast, many veterinarians refused that farmers apply intravenous injections, insert a trocar or treat sole ulcers. In respect to the future development, implications of non-veterinarian interventions on animal welfare, consumer protection and drug safety have to be considered.
bt: Regarding the interventions, most professionals have argued that farmers perform functional foot-washing, infestation, insemination, decoration and castration of calves; on the contrary, many veterinarians have refused to have farmers apply intravenous injections, insert a trocar or treatment for solar ulcer.

src: Indispensable are qualification and skills of the person performing interventions which can be acquired by certificated training courses. Moreover, a basic conception and taking responsibility in particular for application of veterinary drugs is mandatory - in this respect, at present marked deficits exist among many farmers. Based on the current legal situation, several interventions can be delegated to non-veterinarians, but the technical responsibility for the proper implementation is due to the veterinarian.
bt: The qualifications and competence of the person performing the interventions that can be acquired through certified training courses are essential, and a basic concept and assumption of responsibility in particular for the application of veterinary medicines is mandatory - in this regard, there is currently a significant deficit among many farmers.

src: This includes an evaluation of interventions and treatments on a regular basis together with the farmer. On this basis, the assessment of clinical symptoms as well as the initial treatment can be useful and appropriate to ensure a rapid therapy especially in animals suffering from factorial diseases. Having in mind profound differences in respect to the competence of non-veterinarians, general procedures to deliver drugs and to delegate interventions have to be rejected.
bt: This includes an evaluation of interventions and treatments on a regular basis with the farmer, on which basis the assessment of clinical symptoms as well as initial treatment can be useful and appropriate to ensure a rapid therapy especially in animals suffering from fattening disease, given the profound differences in the competence of non-veterinarians, the general procedure for the delivery of medicines and the delegation of interventions must be rejected.

src: Advanced diagnostic procedures and the prescription of veterinary drugs remain an exclusive mission of the veterinarian.
bt: The advanced diagnostic procedure and prescription of veterinary medicines remain an exclusive mission of the veterinarian.

src: Cystic peritoneal mesothelioma is commonly regarded as a benign neoplasm at its first manifestation. It can only seldom show malignant transformation, and only after repeated postoperative recurrences. We hereby represent a unique case of peritoneal cystic mesothelioma, malignant since its first presentation.
bt: Cystic peritoneal mesothelioma is commonly considered a benign neoplasm at its first manifestation.Only rarely can it show a malignant transformation, and only after repeated postoperative recurrence.We represent a unique case of cystic peritoneal mesothelioma, malignant from its first presentation.

src: We observed a 73 year-old man presenting with intermittent abdominal pain and periumbilical swelling. At surgery, we found an extensive, oval-shaped, multi-lobed cystic formation that was surgically removed. Histopathology was consistent with a malignant peritoneal cystic mesothelioma.
bt: We observed a 73-year-old man who had intermittent abdominal pain and periombelic swelling, and during surgery we found a broad, oval-shaped multi-lobal cystic formation that had been surgically removed, and histopathology was consistent with a malignant peritoneal cystic mesothelioma.

src: In agreement with oncologists, we decided not to give any further therapy because of the few possibilities offered by systemic chemotherapy and the paucity of published data from the literature. We planned periodical follow-up including US scan every six and CTscan every 12 months. Several cases of malignant transformation occurring after repeated recurrences of peritoneal mesothelioma have been reported.
bt: In agreement with the oncologists, we decided not to administer further therapy due to the limited possibilities offered by systemic chemotherapy and the scarcity of data published in the literature.We planned a periodic follow-up that included a US scan every six months and a CT scan every 12 months.Several cases of malignant transformation have been reported after recurrent recurrence of peritoneal mesothelioma.

src: To our knowledge, this is the first case showing "ab initio" histological features of malignancy, typical of an active, proliferating and infiltrating lesion. In addition, advanced age and male gender of our patient are extremely peculiar Our observation suggests the possibility, although very rare, that peritoneal cystic mesothelioma may present as malignant since its first manifestation. Peritoneal cystic mesothelioma.
bt: To our knowledge, this is the first case to show histological characteristics "ab initio" of malignancy, typical of an active, proliferating, and infiltrating lesion.In addition, the advanced age and male sex of our patient are extremely peculiar.Our observation suggests the possibility, though very rare, that peritoneal cystic mesothelioma may present as malignant from its first manifestation.

src: This study observed the effects of three different surgical positions on arterial blood oxygenation measured noninvasively by pulse oximetry (SpO2) and on intraocular pressure (IOP) in anaesthetised cats undergoing spay. A total of 222 female feral cats were anaesthetised for a large-scale trap-neuter-return program with an intramuscular combination of medetomidine (0.03 - 0.05 mg/kg), ketamine (7 - 10 mg/kg) and butorphanol (0.4 mg/kg). Cats were randomly allocated to undergo spay in either Trendelenburg (70° downward head tilt), lateral or dorsal recumbency.
bt: This study observed the effects of three different surgical positions on the oxygenation of arterial blood measured non-invasively by pulsosymmetry (SpO2) and on intraocular pressure (IOP) in anaesthetized cats undergoing sterilization.A total of 222 feral female cats were anesthetized for a large-scale neutrinos return program with an intramuscular combination of medetomidine (0.03 - 0.05 mg/kg), ketamine (7-10 mg/kg) and butorfanol (0.4 mg/kg).

src: SpO2 and pulse rate were measured at baseline, prior to surgical positioning, after one minute in surgical position and in one-minute intervals after surgical incision. Intraocular pressure was measured before positioning and at the end of surgery. At the end of surgery, all cats were placed into left lateral recumbency and all parameters were revaluated after five minutes.
bt: SpO2 and heart rate were measured basically, before the surgical positioning, after a minute in surgical position and at intervals of a minute after the surgical incision, intraocular pressure was measured before the positioning and at the end of the procedure, and after the procedure, all cats were placed in a left-sided reclining position and all parameters were re-evaluated after five minutes.

src: No significant differences between the three positions were found regarding SpO2, but an increase over time was observed. In total, 52 ± 10% (mean ± SD) of cats were hypoxaemic (SpO2 < 90%) at baseline. SpO2 improved over time, but 27 ± 3% (mean ± SD) of the cats remained hypoxaemic at the end of surgery.
bt: No significant differences were found between the three positions regarding SpO2, but an increase in time was observed.In total, 52 ± 10% (median ± SD) of cats were ipossiemico (SpO2 <90%) at baseline.The SpO2 improved over time, but 27 ± 3% (median ± SD) of cats remained ipossiemico at the end of the procedure.

src: Trendelenburg position increased IOP during surgery (mean 31 ± 6 mmHg, individual max. 48 mmHg, versus 17 ± 4 mmHg in dorsal/lateral recumbency) but normalised after 5 mins in lateral recumbence. All cats recovered well from surgery and were released within 24 hours post-anaesthesia. Surgical position was shown to have no notable influence on SpO2 during anaesthesia in cats not receiving oxygen supplementation, whereas Trendelenburg position led to increased IOP.
bt: Trendelenburg's position increased the IOP during surgery (median 31 ± 6 mmHg, individual max. 48 mmHg, versus 17 ± 4 mmHg in back/lateral reclination) but normalized after 5 minutes in lateral reclination.All cats recovered well from surgery and were released within 24 hours of anesthesia.The surgical position has been shown to have no noticeable influence on SpO2 during anesthesia in cats that do not receive oxygen supplementation, while Trendelenburg's position led to an increase in the IOP.

src: Oxygen supplementation is recommended with this anaesthetic protocol, as hypoxaemia is frequently observed.
bt: The supplementation of oxygen is recommended with this anesthetic protocol, since hypoxia is frequently observed.

src: The registration of adverse events after the use of immunological veterinary medicinal products (IVMP) is the aim of the vigilance reporting system in Switzerland. Adverse events comprise suspected adverse reactions and lack of expected efficacy. Since the Institute of virology and immunology (IVI) is the competent authority for the regulation of immunological VMP in Switzerland, the reporting system is administrated by the IVI.
bt: The registration of adverse events after the use of immunological veterinary medicines (IVMP) is the goal of the surveillance reporting system in Switzerland.Adverse events include suspected adverse reactions and the lack of expected efficacy.Since the Institute of Virology and Immunology (IVIV) is the competent authority for regulating immunological VMP in Switzerland, the reporting system is administered by the IIV.

src: In 2019, 137 reports concerning authorized immunological VMP were received (15% less compared to 2018). While most of the reports were submitted by the marketing authorization holders (56%), practicing veterinary surgeons contributed to the reporting system, too (40%). This corresponds to an increase of 22% of reported adverse events by the practicing veterinary surgeons compared to the previous year.
bt: In 2019, 137 reports of authorized immunological VMPs were received (15% less than in 2018).Although most of the reports were submitted by marketing authorization holders (56%), veterinary practitioners also contributed to the reporting system (40%).This corresponds to a 22% increase in adverse events reported by veterinary practitioners compared to the previous year.

src: Private persons (4%) submitted five reports. In comparison to 2018, in 2019 79% of the adverse events were reported by marketing authorization holders and 18% by veterinarians. Dogs (55%) and cats (20%) were mainly affected.
bt: The private sector (4%) submitted five reports: in 2018, 79% of adverse events were reported by marketing authorisation holders and 18% by veterinarians, with dogs (55%) and cats (20%) being mainly affected.

src: Further reports were related to cattle (13%) and horses (5%). Recently, the numbers of reports concerning dogs (+12%) and cats (+4%) have considerably increased. Most of the reports were based on the application of vaccines against canine distemper, hepatitis, parvovirosis and parainfluenza in combination with leptospirosis in dogs as well as cat flu and feline panleukopenia in cats.
bt: Additional reports have been made regarding cattle (13%) and horses (5%).Recently, the number of reports concerning dogs (+12%) and cats (+4%) has increased significantly.Most reports have been based on the application of vaccines against canine fever, hepatitis, parvovirus and parainfluenza in combination with leptospirosis in dogs and feline influenza and feline panleucopenia in cats.

src: In 34% of the submitted cases, the causality assessment between the vaccination and the reaction described was evaluated as probable.
bt: In 34% of the cases, the assessment of the causal link between vaccination and the described reaction was assessed as likely.

src: Aspiration risk has a substantial influence on clinical management of swallowing disorders, and can be associated with pharyngeal residue. The aims of this cross-sectional study are to examine the correlation between the presence of pharyngeal residue and penetration-aspiration during fiberoptic endoscopic evaluation of swallowing (FEES), examine the correlation between objective data and Functional Oral Intake Scale (FOIS) and determine whether using objective assessment (Pooling score and Penetration Aspiration Scale-PAS) to categorise patients as pathological or not identifies the same patients identified by FOIS. Fifty-five patients with neurogenic dysphagia were evaluated during FEES by using the Pooling Score scale and PAS.
bt: The risk of aspiration has a significant influence on the clinical management of swallowing disorders and can be associated with pharyngeal residues.The purpose of this cross-sectional study is to examine the correlation between the presence of pharyngeal residues and penetration-aspiration during endoscopic evaluation in fiber optic swallowing (FEES), examine the correlation between objective data and the functional oral intake scale (FOIS) and determine whether to use objective assessment (pooling score and penetration aspiration scale-PAS) to classify patients as pathological or not to identify the same patients with pathogenic disease.Fifty-five patients with neurodysphagia were identified during the FEES using the PAS and pooling score scales.

src: They underwent an assessment of nutritional modalities using FOIS. There was a significant positive correlation between Pooling score and PAS scores for semisolid bolus (Pearson = 0.305; p = 0.024) and liquids (Pearson = 0.841; p = 0.000). The semi-solid bolus Pooling score had a negative correlation with FOIS (Pearson =- 0.355; p = 0.008), but there were no other significant correlations for FOIS with Pooling score or PAS.
bt: They were subjected to an evaluation of nutritional modalities using FOIS.There was a significant positive correlation between the Pooling score and the PAS score for the semi-solid ball (Pearson = 0.305; p = 0.024) and the liquid (Pearson = 0.841; p = 0.000).The pooling score of the semi-solid ball had a negative correlation with the FOIS (Pearson =- 0.355; p = 0.008), but there were no other significant correlations for the FOIS score with the pooling score or the PAS.

src: There were significant differences between objective assessments (P-score/PAS) and functional measure (FOIS) for identifying patients as pathological; although the positive predictive values were high, the negative predictive values were very low. Although pharyngeal residues are significantly associated with the presence of penetration-aspiration during endoscopy, the real intake modalities are not correlated with objective assessments of swallowing disorders. Therefore, clinicians need to implement a comprehensive approach to assess dysphagia.
bt: Although the positive predictive values were high, the negative predictive values were very low. Although the residues of faringe were significantly associated with the presence of penetration-aspiration during endoscopy, the actual mode of intake is not correlated with the objective evaluations of swallowing disorders.

src: The study proposes a new flap drawing derived from the modification of a triangular Cogswell flap to treat a semi-included third molar. Two groups of patients underwent surgery: in the study group the new flap proposal was carried out whilst in the control group the triangular Cogswell flap was used. The gingival tissue and the periosteum were detached and the extraction technique was standardised for all the cases.
bt: The study proposes a new design of the lembo derived from the modification of a Cogswell triangular lembo to treat a semi-inclusive third molar.Two groups of patients underwent surgery: in the study group the new lembo proposal was made, while in the control group the Cogswell triangular lembo was used.The gum tissue and periosteum were detached and the extraction technique was standardized for all cases.

src: At 7 days and at 14 days from the operation, the results showed a statistically significant difference in the increase in primary intention healing in the study group whereas no statistically significant difference was encountered between using the innovative flap or the triangular Cogswell flap in terms of swelling. The patients who underwent the innovative flap operation presented an increased percentage of primary intention healing compared to the patients who underwent the baseline method. As known from the international literature, a correct operational conduct aims at reducing surgical trauma as much as possible in order to limit the immediate and delayed consequences of surgery.
bt: Seven days and 14 days after the operation, the results showed a statistically significant difference in the increase in primary intent healing in the study group, while no statistically significant difference was found between the use of the innovative lembo or Cogswell's triangular lembo in terms of swelling.The patients who underwent all the innovative flap surgery had a higher percentage of primary intent healing than patients who underwent the basic method.

src: Nevertheless the lengthening of healing times also leads to an increase of probability that post-operative complications and worse quality of life for the patients arise. The Cogswell triangular flap modified and translated represents a new method available to the oral surgeon, useful in soft tissue management for the extraction of semi-included third mandibular molars. Simple to carry out, it promotes primary intention healing with absence of an increase in complications such as swelling²6¯³0.
bt: However, extended recovery times also increase the likelihood of complications following surgery and a worse quality of life for patients.The modified and translated Cogswell triangular lembo represents a new method available to the oral surgeon, useful in the management of soft tissues for the extraction of third-party molars, semi-inclusive mandibular membranes.Simply executed, it promotes primary intentional healing without an increase in complications such as swelling26 ̄30.

src: Cogswell triangular flap, Mandibular molar, Oral surgery.
bt: Cogswell's triangular limb, mandibular molars, and oral surgery.

src: The role of livestock veterinarian has changed in recent decades and the advisory role of veterinarians is becoming increasingly important. Only vague statements have been made about the current distribution and content of the livestock management in Switzerland. The aim of this study was to collect information and data on veterinary services and the use of livestock management for cattle and pigs and to describe the current situation in Switzerland.
bt: The role of the veterinarian has changed in recent decades and his consulting function is becoming increasingly important.Only vague statements have been made about the current distribution and content of livestock management in Switzerland.The purpose of this study was to collect information and data on veterinary services and the use of livestock management for cattle and pigs and to describe the current situation in Switzerland.

src: Therefore, a survey was carried out among veterinarians and farmers. The results show that around half (46%) of the surveyed veterinarians offer livestock management. However, the majority (61%) of farmers do not make use of the livestock management.
bt: Therefore, a survey was conducted between veterinarians and breeders, and the results show that about half (46%) of the veterinarians interviewed offer livestock management; however, the majority (61%) of farmers do not approve of livestock management.

src: Around one third of the farms (31%) are serviced by the animal health services and almost every tenth farm (8%) using the integrated veterinary livestock management (ITB). The service is mainly used by larger cattle and pig farms. The number of cattle in managed and non-managed farms differ significantly (p = 0.01).
bt: About one third of farms (31%) are managed by animal health services and almost every tenth (8%) use integrated veterinary management of livestock (ITB).The service is mainly used by cattle and large pig farms.The number of cattle in managed and unmanaged farms differs significantly (p = 0,01).

src: In general, pig farms are managed more frequently than cattle farms - mostly in the form of an agreement with the Pig Health Service (SGD). 76% of pig farms, 21% of cattle farms and 44% of mixed farms are using the livestock management. The majority (79%) of the surveyed veterinarians classify the market for livestock management small and its future importance is largely assessed stable or decreasing by veterinarians and farmers.
bt: In general, pig farms are managed more frequently than cattle farms, mainly in the form of an agreement with the Pig Health Service (SGD).76% of pig farms, 21% of cattle farms and 44% of mixed-breed farms use cattle management.The majority (79%) of veterinarians surveyed classify the cattle management market as small and its future importance is widely assessed as stable or declining by veterinarians and breeders.

src: Half of the veterinarians and a tenth of farmers without livestock management mention excessively high costs as a reason for the limited market. In addition, more than half of the farmers with livestock management name costs as the limiting factor. Veterinarians see the greatest advantage of livestock management in cattle fertility, udder health and milk quality, while pig farms profit in reduced use of veterinary drugs, improved herd health and disease prophylaxis.
bt: Half of veterinarians and one-tenth of farmers without livestock management cite excessive costs as a reason for the market constraint, and more than half of farmers with the name livestock management as a limiting factor, see the greatest benefit of livestock management in livestock fertility, mammalian health and milk quality, while pig farms benefit from the less use of veterinary medicines, improved herd health and disease prevention.

src: We aimed to show whether ischemia reperfusion (I/R) injury causes damage on brain or not, and whether thymoquinone and silymarin, as antioxidant and anti-inflammatory herbs, have beneficial effects on this damage or not. Forty Wistar albino rats were carried out and were randomized to 4 groups with equal numbers (n=10): sham group, implemented of only anesthesia; control group, implemented of anesthesia and I/R injury; silymarin group, implemented of anesthesia and I/R injury and treated with a dose of 200 milligram/kg silymarin ip and thymoquinone group, implemented of anesthesia and I/R injury and treated with a dose of 20 mg/kg thymoquinone. Serum lipid hydroperoxide (LOOH) and total free sulfhydryl (Sh) levels were determined.
bt: We tried to prove whether the injury from the infusion of ischemia (I/R) causes brain damage or not, and whether timoquinone and silimarin, like antioxidants and anti-inflammatory herbs, have beneficial effects on this damage or not. Forty Wistar albin rats were randomized into four groups with equal numbers (n=10): sham group, actuato di sola anestesia; control group, actuato di anestesia e danno I/R; silimarin group, actuato di anestesia e danno I/R were treated with a dose of 200 milligrams/kg of silimarin e timoquinone, actuato di ipatinine and danno I/R were treated with a dose of 20 kg/kg of thimatinone.

src: Light microscopy was used to evaluate histological changes in brain tissue. Serum LOOH levels (0.21 ± 0.04 for control group, 0.29 ± 0.01 for sham group, 0.23 ± 0.09 for silymarin group, 0.29 ± 0.09 for thymoquinone group) were significantly higher and Sh levels (10.74 ± 1.71 for control group, 6.82 ± 0.24 for sham group, 9.12 ± 1.04 for silymarin group, 8.41 ± 1.12 for thymoquinone group) were significantly lower in control, silymarin and thymoquinone groups compared to control group (p<0.05 for all). According to the histopathologic damage score assessment, it was seen that the damage decreased significantly in the silymarin and the thymoquinone groups.
bt: The serum levels of LOOH (0.21 ± 0.04 per control group, 0.29 ± 0.01 per sham group, 0.23 ± 0.09 per silimarin group, 0.29 ± 0.09 per thymoquinone group) were significantly higher and the levels of Sh (10.74 ± 1.71 per control group, 6.82 ± 0.24 per sham group, 9.12 ± 1.04 per silimarin group, 8.41 ± 1.12 per thymoquinone group) were significantly lower in the control groups, silimarin and timochinone compared to the control group (p <0.05 per all).

src: We showed that tissue damage also occurs in brain following the ischemia reperfusion. It was shown that thymoquinone and silymarin is quite effective in preventing this damage. Brain, Hydroperoxide levels, Ischemia reperfusion injury, Sulfhydryl levels, Silymarin, Thymoquinone.
bt: We have shown that tissue damage also occurs in the brain after the re-infusion of ischemia.Thymoquinone and silimarin have been shown to be quite effective in preventing this damage.Cerebral, hydroxide levels, re-infusion damage from ischemia, sulfidrile levels, silimarin, timochinone.

src: The anatomical dissection plays a fundamental role in the students' formation as well as in the specialists' updating. In contrast to what happened in the sixteenth century, when medical students and professors from all over the Europe were used to come in Italy, today Italian surgeons have to go abroad to attend training courses, with inevitable economic costs and personal inconveniences. The reason for this circumstance lies in the existence of obsolete and even ethically unacceptable legal rules.
bt: The anatomical dissection plays a fundamental role in the training of students and the updating of specialists.Unlike in the 16th century, when medical students and professors from all over Europe were accustomed to coming to Italy, today Italian surgeons have to go abroad to attend training courses, with inevitable economic costs and personal disadvantages.

src: The recent unanimous approval by the Italian Senate of the bill on postmortem body donation opens important perspectives. The authors, after having reviewed the main historical stages in anatomical dissection, examine the above mentioned recent bill n. 733 (XVIII Legislature) concerning the disposition of one's body and post-mortem tissues for the purposes of study, training and scientific research, taking into consideration also the international context. The bill aims to fill the serious legislative gap, not only offering the possibility of satisfying the noble needs of human solidarity, but also giving to future doctors a contact with death capable of promoting human and ethical values such as the respect for life.
bt: The recent unanimous approval by the Italian Senate of the bill on donation post mortem poses an important prospect.The authors, after reviewing the main historical stages of the anatomical dissection, examine the recent bill No. 733 (XVIII Legislatura) concerning the disposal of one's own body and post mortem tissues for the purpose of study, training and scientific research, taking into account also the international context.The bill aims to fill the grave legislative void, not only by offering the possibility of meeting the noble needs of human solidarity, but also by giving future physicians a contact with death that can promote human values such as respect for life and ethics.

src: The Italian legal system presents - right now - serious operational gaps which make body donation practically unapplied. While waiting for the bill to finally see light, it is necessary to engage in educational activities that can promote the culture of this "gift" and, at the same time, that of respect for the body of the deceased person. Anatomical dissection, Body donation, Study and research.
bt: The Italian legal order presents - at this time - a serious operational gap that makes the donation of the body virtually inapplicable.Until the draft law finally comes to light, it is necessary to engage in educational activities that promote the culture of this dono and, at the same time, that of respect for the body of the deceased person.

src: Rhinophyma is a rare and benign pathological condition affecting the nose. It can be localized or generalized causing a nasal deformity, mainly of the lower 2/3 of the nose. Clinically, rhinophyma is characterized by the aberrant development of the vascularization of the skin of the nose.
bt: Rhinoplasty is a rare and benign pathological condition that affects the nose.It can be localized or generalized causing a nasal deformity, mainly of the lower two-thirds of the nose.Clinically, rhinoplasty is characterized by the abnormal development of vascularisation of the nasal skin.

src: The nose becomes particularly sensitive, and even a minimal external trauma can cause bleeding. Different treatment methods have been described during the last few years, but surgery still remains the gold standard. The aim is to obtain a reduction of the abnormal tissue, by debulking and fine contouring followed by hemostasis and a very careful postoperative care.
bt: The nose becomes particularly sensitive and even minimal external trauma can cause bleeding.In recent years, several treatment methods have been described, but surgery remains the gold standard.The goal is to achieve a reduction in abnormal tissue, through a fine contouring and contouring followed by emostasis and a careful postoperative cure.

src: Herein we report one case of Rhinophyma treated with the Microdebrider (Storz®). A 70 year old male with a diagnosis of rhinophyma was admitted to the Department of Maxillo-Facial Surgery of "Federico II" University of Naples. The patient underwent a debridment of rhinophyma, combining dermabrasion and decortication, using a Microdebrider (Storz®).
bt: Here we report a case of Rhinophyma treated with the Microdebrider (Storz®).A 70-year-old man with a diagnosis of rhinopathy was admitted to the Department of Maxillofacial Surgery of the University of Naples Federico II.The patient underwent a rhinopathy treatment, combining dermoabrasione and decorticazione, using a Microdebrider (Storz®).

src: After the surgery, the wound was covered with an advanced dressing, a collagen sponge equina (Condress®) applied at the end of the procedure and routinely during the follow up control to promote the healing process. After 2 months the patient was completely healed without any complications and without any signs of recurrence, obtaining a good aesthetic and functional result. After 25 months of follow up the result is still stable.
bt: After the surgery, the wound was covered with an advanced medication, an equine collagen sponge (Condress®) applied at the end of the procedure and routinely during subsequent controls to facilitate the healing process.After 2 months the patient was completely healed without complications and without signs of recurrence, achieving a good aesthetic and functional result.After 25 months of follow-up the result is still stable.

src: Rhinophyma, Microdebrider.
bt: Rhinophyma, Microdebrider.

src: Cutaneous basal cell carcinoma (cBCC) is the most common malignancy diagnosed in the human population. cBCC presents an increasing incidence which, in the near future, will be higher than all other cancers combined. The majority of cBCC are located in the head and the neck. A diversity of management modalities is currently available; nonetheless, surgical excision remains the main modality of treatment. cBCC rarely metastasises and presents a low mortality rate. cBCC morbidity is influenced by local invasion and destruction, especially in the face, where function and aesthetics are major issues.
bt: Basal cell carcinoma of the skin (cBCC) is the most common type of cancer diagnosed in the human population. cBCC has a growing incidence that in the near future will be higher than that of all other tumors combined. most CBCCs are found in the head and neck. a variety of management methods are currently available; however, surgical excision remains the main mode of treatment. cBCC rarely metastasizes and presents a low mortality rate. cBCC morbidity is influenced by local invasions and destruction, especially in facial anatomy, where function and est are important problems.

src: Easy accessibility to the face and skin on the neck makes cBCC an important issue for otorhinolaryngology head and neck surgeons who must be aware and committed in its management, as the main modality of treatment continues to be surgical. The aim of this review is to present a brief and practical overview of head and neck cBCC management for ear, nose and throat (ENT) surgeons, discussing key issues about its epidemiology, risk factors, diagnosis and pathogenesis.
bt: The easy accessibility of the face and neck skin makes the cBCC an important problem for otolaryngological surgeons who must be aware and committed to its management, as the main mode of treatment continues to be surgical.The purpose of this review is to present a brief and practical overview of the management of the cBCC of the head and neck for ear, nose and throat (ORL) surgeons, discussing key questions about its epidemiology, risk factors, diagnosis and pathogenesis.

src: With this experimental study we investigated the consequences of ligation of the common bile duct (CBD) on hepatic cells and on the renal ultrastructure by electron microscopy and also determine the effects after liberation of the ductus joint in order to clarify the mechanisms of renal failure commonly observed in cholestatic liver disease. The study was conducted on 53 Wistar albino rats divided into 4 subgroups. In the comparison group (sham) we proceeded to the simple laparotomy.
bt: With this experimental study we studied the consequences of the binding of the common bile duct (CBD) on liver cells and on the renal structure using electronic microscopy and also determined the effects after the release of the duct's joint in order to clarify the mechanisms of renal failure commonly observed in colestatic liver disease.The study was conducted on 53 rats in the Wistar albinos divided into 4 subgroups.In the comparison group (sham) the procedure was simple laparotomy.

src: After preparation of the common bile duct of all the rats of the four groups, and ligation of the duct at the level of the distal third, eight rats in each group were sacrificed on the 3rd, 7th, 10th and 14th day after surgery, taking blood samples to measure the serum levels of ALP and bilirubin, and liver and renal tissue samples for histological evaluation. In four rats of each group the common bile duct was unligated at the same deadlines to obtain free drainage of the bile for a week. At the end of this week, the rats were sacrificed by collecting blood and liver and kidney tissue samples. after CBD ligation in both groups, the ALP value, total and direct bilurubin levels were proportionally increased.
bt: After preparing the joint biliary doctor of all the rats of the four groups and unbinding the joint biliary doctor at the third distal level, eight rats of each group were sacrificed on the third, seventh, tenth and fourteenth days after the operation, taking blood samples to measure serum levels of ALP and bilirubin and liver and kidney tissue samples for histological evaluation. In four rats of each group the joint biliary doctor was unbundled at the same time frame to obtain free drain of bile for one week.

src: After duct release, bilurubin levels decreased significantly. In group II, while large lipid granules were observed to indicate oxidative damage, mitochondrial swelling and crystals were observed after duct liberation. Areas of glycogen and normal mitochondria were observed in group IV. After duct release in this group, increases in Ito granules, lipid granules and normal mitochondria were observed, which may reflect the evolution of hepatic regeneration.
bt: After the release of the dotto, the levels of bilurubin decreased significantly.In group II, while large lipid granules were observed to indicate oxidative damage, mitochondrial swelling and crystals were observed after the release of the dotto.Glycogen areas and normal mitochondria were observed in group IV.After the release of the dotto in this group, increases in Ito granules, lipid granules and normal mitochondria were observed, which may reflect the evolution of liver regeneration.

src: When renal tissue was examined in group II, fusion processes in the feet, thickening of the basement membrane and mesengium were observed, and mitochondrial crystals were observed in renal tissue as well as in the liver after duct release. Damage in group III and group IV was increased parallel to prolongation of jaundice and after loosening persistent damage with mitochondrial crystals. Ultrastructural changes in rat liver tissue in conditions of obstructive jaundice may be reversible after restoration of drainage.
bt: When the kidney tissue in group II was examined, fusion processes in the feet, thickening of the basal and mesenchymal membranes were observed, and mitochondrial crystals were observed in kidney tissue and liver after the doctor's release. The damage in group III and group IV was increased in parallel with the extension of the itero and after slowing the persistent damage with mitochondrial crystals.Ultrastructural changes in rat liver tissue in the obstructive ittero conditions can be reversible after the restoration of drainage.

src: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused significant impact on healthcare systems worldwide. The rate of infected healthcare workers is > 10% in Italy. Within this dramatic scenario, the development of new personal protective equipment (PPE) devices is mandatory.
bt: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a significant impact on healthcare systems worldwide.The percentage of healthcare providers infected is > 10% in Italy.In this dramatic scenario, the development of new personal protective devices (PPE) is mandatory.

src: This study focuses on validation of modified full-face snorkel masks (MFFSM) as safe and protective equipment against SARS-CoV-2 infection during diagnostic and therapeutic procedures on the upper aerodigestive tract. Five different MFFSM were tested during otolaryngological surgery and in anaesthesia procedures. Data were collected through an online survey to assess the feedback of operators. pO All five MFFSM tested were easy to use and gave all operators a sound "feeling" of protection.
bt: This study focuses on the validation of modified full-facial snorkeling masks (MFFSM) as safe and protective devices against SARS-CoV-2 infection during the diagnostic and therapeutic procedure on the upper airway.Five different MFFSMs were tested during otorinolaryngological surgery and in anesthesia procedures.The data were collected through an online survey to evaluate the feedback of operators. pO All five tested MFFSMs were easy to use and gave all operators a good "feel" of protection.

src: All clinicians involved had common agreement regarding safety and the user-friendly format. In the future, specific development of different type of masks for protection in the operating room, intensive care units and/or office will be possible as a joint venture between clinicians and developers. Goals for clinicians include better definition of needs and priorities, while developers can devote their expertise to produce devices that meet medical requirements.
bt: All the doctors involved agreed on safety and intuitive format, and in the future, specific development of different types of masks for protection in the operating room, intensive care unit and/or office will be possible as a joint venture between doctors and developers, with the goal of better defining medical needs and priorities, while developers can dedicate their experience to producing devices that meet medical requirements.

src: Milk production in Switzerland is mainly based on herbage feeding with little input of concentrates. The present study investigated the effects of a solely herbage-based diet with (C) and without concentrate (nC) supplementation on luteal activity, milk production and metabolic status in 23 multiparous Holstein dairy cows with early or delayed resumption of ovarian cyclicity post partum (pp). Cows were retrospectively assigned either to a group with early (until d 25 pp, EOV) or delayed resumption of ovarian activity (> d 30 pp, DOV), resulting in four subgroups depending on concentrate feeding: DOV-C, DOV-nC, EOV-C, EOV-nC. Milk progesterone (P4) concentration was measured every 3 d, and different metabolites were analyzed in weekly blood samples.
bt: The present study examined the effects of a diet exclusively based on herbs with (C) and without concentration (nC) on luteal activity, on the production of milk and on the metabolic state in 23 milk cows with early recovery or delayed ovarian cyclicity postpartum (pp).The cows were assigned retrospectively to a group with early recovery (up to 25 pp, EOV) or delayed recovery of ovarian activity (> 30 pp, ovV), with the resulting concentration of the following four subgroups of the concentrated diet: VC-C, DOVn-C, DOC-OVn, EOVn-C. The results of each weekly analysis of three samples of varicose veins were analysed.

src: Resumption of ovarian activity was detected between d 19 and 25 pp in EOV, and between d 30 and 60 pp in DOV. In DOV-C, resumption of cyclicity tended to start earlier (38.3 ± 1.7 d pp) compared to DOV-nC (45.2 ± 6.3 d pp; P = 0.10). Independent of grouping, the ovarian activity occurred later in cows with greater plasma β-hydroxybutyrate (BHB) concentrations
