src: Modified methods of arytenoid adduction (AA) have been reported to keep the cricothyroid (CT) joint intact. However, postoperative laryngeal oedema and long-term vocal function have not been compared with those after AA with CT joint separation. We refined AA to combine it with nerve-muscle pedicle (NMP) flap transfer for preservation of the CT joint.
bt: Modified methods of arithenoid (AA) addition have been reported to keep the cricothyroid joint (TC) intact; however, postoperative laryngeal edema and long-term vocal function have not been compared with those after AA with CT joint separation.

src: Eight patients with unilateral laryngeal paralysis underwent the procedure (Group 1). Postoperative oedema at membranous vocal fold (MVF), arytenoid mound (AM) and pyriform sinus (PS) was assessed using a 4-point ordinal scale: none (0) to severe (3). Laryngeal oedema in Group 1 was compared with that of 19 patients who had AA with CT joint separation (Group 2).
bt: Eight patients with unilateral laryngeal paralysis underwent the procedure (Group 1).Post-operative edema at the level of the membranous vocal fold (MVF), the arithenoid moncone (AM) and the piriform breast (PS) was assessed using an ordinal scale of 4 points: none (0) to severe (3).

src: Maximum phonation time (MPT), jitter and voice handicap index-10 (VHI-10) were measured before surgery and one year postoperatively. Vocal function in Group 1 was compared with 58 patients who underwent AA + NMP flap transfer with CT joint separation (Group 3). The degree of oedema from postoperative days 1 to 6 in Group 1 was relatively invariable: 1.2~1.6 at MVF, 1.3~1.7 at AM, and 1.4~1.7 at PS.
bt: The maximum frequency of function (MPT), tremor index and voice disability index-10 (VHI-10) were measured before surgery and one year after surgery.Voice function in Group 1 was compared with 58 patients who underwent transfer with either AA + NMP with joint separation CT (Group 3).The degree of edema from postoperative days 1 to 6 in Group 1 was relatively unchanged: 1.2 ~ 1.6 in MVF, 1.3 ~ 1.7 in AM and 1.4 ~ 1.7 in PS.

src: The scores at 3 and 4 days postoperatively at MVF and PS in Group 1 were significantly lower than in Group 2 (P = 0.0032 and 0.0317 at day 3, and 0.0224 and 0.0182, at day 4, respectively). The degree of oedema at day 3 at AM in Group 1 was significantly less than in Group 2 (P = 0.0260). One year after surgery, there were no significant differences in MPT, jitter and VHI-10 between Groups 1 and 3 (P = 0.660, 0.111 and 0.556, respectively).
bt: The post-operative scores at 3 and 4 days MVF and PS in Group 1 were significantly lower than those in Group 2 (P = 0.0032 and 0.0317 per day 3 and 0.0224 and 0.0182, respectively per day 4).The degree of edema at day 3 in the morning in Group 1 was significantly lower than that in Group 2 (P = 0.0260).

src: Preservation of the CT joint might be beneficial in reducing the maximum degree of laryngeal oedema after AA. Vocal function after AA + NMP flap transfer with CT joint preservation is comparable to that after AA + NMP flap transfer with CT joint separation.
bt: Conservation of the TC joint can be useful in reducing the maximum degree of laryngeal edema after angioplasty.The vocal function after the transfer of the AA+NMP joint with conservation of the CT joint is comparable to that after the transfer of the AA+NMP joint with separation of the CT joint.

src: We describe an uncommon case of a Meckel's diverticulum perforation by a chicken bone in a patient with symptoms of acute appendicitis. Meckel's diverticulum is the most common congenital abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract. The incidence is approximately 2% of the population.
bt: We describe a non-common case of perforation of the Meckel diverticulum by a chicken bone in a patient with symptoms of acute appendicitis.Meckel diverticulum is the most common congenital anomaly of the gastrointestinal tract.The incidence is about 2% of the population.

src: Most patients are asymptomatic, only 4-16% presenting complications, including bleeding, obstruction, and diverticulitis. The perforation due to a foreign body is a very infrequent complication and may have a bad prognosis in case of a delayed diagnosis. Only in a few cases, a careful evaluation of the CT scan leads to correct preoperative diagnosis.
bt: Most patients are asymptomatic, with only 4-16% having complications, including bleeding, obstruction and diverticolitis.Puration from a foreign body is a very rare complication and can have a negative prognosis if diagnosed late.Only in a few cases, a careful assessment of the CT leads to a correct preoperative diagnosis.

src: Definitive treatment is surgical intervention and should not be delayed in patients with peritonitis. Laparoscopy is a safe diagnostic and therapeutic tool to treat complicated Meckel's diverticulum. In our case, a stapled laparoscopic diverticulectomy has been performed with an excellent outcome.
bt: The definitive treatment is surgery and should not be delayed in patients with peritonitis.Laparoscopy is a safe diagnostic and therapeutic tool to treat complicated Meckel diverticolo.In our case, a stapler laparoscopic diverticolectomy has been performed with excellent results.

src: KEY WORDS: Laparoscopy, Meckel's diverticulum, Perforation.
bt: Key words: Laparoscopy, diverticolo by Meckel, drilling.

src: Thanks to wide central connections the vestibular system is not merely involved in reflexes, but it is also connected to cognitive processes. A growing body of literature suggests that it has a substantial impact on cognitive function. These cognitive interactions include memory, attention, mental imagery, body awareness and social cognition.
bt: Thanks to the extensive central connections, the vestibular system is not only involved in reflexes, but also connected to cognitive processes.A growing body of literature suggests that it has a substantial impact on cognitive function.These cognitive interactions include memory, attention, mental imagery, body awareness, and social cognition.

src: Spatial working memory (SWM) is a kind of short-term memory that allows to temporarily store and manipulate spatial information. It has a limited capacity and is quite vulnerable to interference. The single most important nonverbal task for assessment of visuo-spatial working memory (VSWM) is the Corsi block tapping task (CBTT), also known as the Corsi Span Test.
bt: The spatial working memory (SWM) is a type of short-term memory that allows temporary memorization and manipulation of spatial information.It has a limited capacity and is quite vulnerable to interference.The most important non-verbal task for evaluating the visual-space working memory (VSWM) is the Corsi block tapping task (CBTT), also known as the Corsi Span Test.

src: We evaluated 263 patients suffering from chronic unilateral or bilateral vestibular loss (VL) by eCorsi Block-Tapping test before and after 5 days of instrumental vestibular training (IVT). The data were compared with those of 834 subjects submitted to the same test: 430 healthy people (HP) and 404 patients suffering from chronic VL but not treated by IVT. At all ages, the Corsi block test score was extremely statistically significantly higher (p < 0.0001) in HP than in both groups of VL.
bt: We evaluated 263 patients with unilateral or bilateral vestibular chronic loss (VL) using the EcoRSI Block-Tapping test before and after 5 days of instrumental vestibular training (IVT).The data were compared with those of 834 subjects subjected to the same test: 430 healthy people (HP) and 404 patients with chronic VL but not treated with IVT. At all ages, the score of the Corsi block test was extremely statistically significantly higher (p < 0.0001) in HP compared to both groups of VL.

src: The score showed a statistically significant difference with age and sex in healthy subjects as younger males obtained the best results. Our study confirms the significant interference of the vestibular input on VSWM and impairment of this cognitive function in patients suffering from chronic UL or BIL. It also shows that IVT is able to improve VSWM even in cases where the deficit is greater.
bt: The score showed a statistically significant difference with age and sex in healthy subjects since younger males achieved the best results.Our study confirms the significant interference of vestibular input on VSWM and the impairment of this cognitive function in patients with chronic UL or BIL.It also shows that IVT is able to improve VSWM even in cases where the deficit is greater.

src: A 64-year-old woman presented to our emergency department during the outbreak of the covid-19 emergency in Italy with syncope, anosmia, mild dyspnoea and atypical chest and dorsal pain. A chest CT scan showed an acute type B aortic dissection (ATBAD) and bilateral lung involvement with ground-glass opacity, compatible with interstitial pneumonia. Nasopharyngeal swabs resulted positive for SARS-CoV-2.
bt: A 64-year-old woman was presented to our emergency room during the outbreak of the covid-19 emergency in Italy with synotic, anosmia, mild dyspnea and atypical chest and back pain.A chest CT showed acute aortic dissection of type B (ATBAD) and bilateral pulmonary involvement with a mirigliato glass opacity, compatible with an interstitial pneumonia.The nasopharyngeal tampons were positive for SARS-CoV-2.

src: For the persistence of chest pain, despite the analgesic therapy, we decided to treat her with a TEVAR. Patient's chest and back pain resolved during the first few days after the procedure. No surgical or respiratory complications occurred and the patient was discharged 14 days after surgery.
bt: Because the chest pain persisted despite analgesic therapy, we decided to treat it with a TEVAR.The pain in the patient's chest and back resolved during the first few days after the procedure.Not if surgical or respiratory complications were detected and the patient was discharged 14 days after the procedure.

src: By performing the operation under local anesthesia, it was possible to limit both the staff inside the operatory room and droplet/aerosol release. Since we had to perform the operation in a hemodynamics room, thanks to the limited extension of the endoprosthesis and the good caliber of the right vertebral artery we were able to reduce the risk of spinal cord ischemia despite the lack of a revascularization of the left subclavian artery. A minimally invasive total endovascular approach allows, through local anesthesia and percutaneous access, to avoid surgical cut down and orotracheal intubation.
bt: By performing the operation under local anesthesia, it was possible to limit both the personnel inside the operating room and the release of goccioline/aerosol.Because we had to perform the operation in a hemodynamic room, thanks to the limited extension of the endoprosthetic and the good caliber of the right vertebral artery, we were able to reduce the risk of middlecardia despite the lack of a rivascolarization of the left subclavian artery.A minimally invasive total endovascular approach allows, through local anesthesia and percutaneous access, to avoid surgical cuts and orotracheal intubation.

src: This, combined with a defined management protocol for infected patients, seems to be a reasonable way to perform endovascular aortic procedures in urgent setting, even in a SARSCoV- 2 positive patient. COVID-19, Dissection, TEVAR.
bt: This, combined with a definite management protocol for infected patients, seems to be a reasonable way to perform an endovascular aortic procedure in an emergency setting, even in a SARSCoV-2 positive patient.

src: To investigate the presence of association between the personality trait and the onset of postoperative complications in patients undergoing enterostomy packaging. Systematic review of the literature. Type D personality traits and those with a low tendency to optimism and temperament (ex. anxiety-depressive syndrome) would seem to be associated with an increased risk of developing postoperative psychiatric morbidity and reduced levels of health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in enterostomized patients for colorectal cancer (CRC).
bt: It is investigated whether there is an association between personality traits and the occurrence of postoperative complications in patients undergoing enterostomy packing. Systematic review of the literature. Treatments of type D personality and those with a low tendency to optimism and temperament (e.g. anxiety-depressive syndrome) appear to be associated with a higher risk of developing post-operative psychiatric morbidity and reduced health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in patients with enterostomized colorectal cancer (CRC).

src: Also, type-D personality, has been associated with greater risk of multiple comorbidities including an increased risk of heart failure unrelated to other sociodemographic causes 32-34-35. Personality with little tendency to optimism may represent a predictive factor on the development of psychological suffering one year after the diagnosis of CRC 3. Patients with personality traits associated with reduced levels of life satisfaction and / or reduced coping capacity require longer hospitalization time 26.
bt: In addition, personality type D has been associated with an increased risk of multiple comorbidities, including an increased risk of heart failure not related to other socio-demographic causes 32-34-35.Personality with a low tendency to optimism may be a predictive factor of psychological distress development a year after the diagnosis of CRC 3.Patients with personality traits associated with reduced levels of life satisfaction and/or reduced coping capacity require longer hospitalization times 26.

src: Several studies highlight the presence of association between personality traits oriented to performance, persistence and extroversion and outcomes in various areas of surgery 14,2,-27,30. However, in almost all cases, the outcomes measured do not correspond to the early post-operative complications defined in the inclusion criteria but to mediumlong term psychological and rehabilitative outcomes. From the review study, no sources were found concerning the association between the personality trait and the onset of early postoperative complications in enterostomised patients, highlighting, furthermore, a lack of data on the subject involving the entire field of abdominal surgery.
bt: Several studies show an association between performance-oriented personality traits, persistence and extroversion, and results in various areas of surgery 14,2,-27,30.However, in almost all cases, the measured results do not correspond to the early post-operative complications defined in these inclusion criteria, but to the psychological and rehabilitative outcomes in the medium to long term.From the review study, no emerging sources regarding the association between personality traits and the occurrence of early post-operative complications in patients with osteostoma, evidence also shows a lack of data on the topic that involves the entire field of abdominal surgery.

src: Personality trait, Enterostomy, Post-operative complications.
bt: Treatment of personality, enterostomy, complications after surgery.

src: The recent literature on laryngeal surgical oncology has increasingly focused on the negative prognostic impact of neoplastic involvement of the posterior portion of the inferior paraglottic space, which we refer to as the “thyro-cricoarytenoid space” (TCAS). We retrospectively considered the prognostic significance of TCAS involvement in a cohort of 84 patients treated with open partial horizontal laryngectomy for glottic squamous cell carcinoma. Univariate analysis was conducted on the prognostic value of several clinical and pathological parameters.
bt: Recent literature on larynx surgical oncology is increasingly focused on the negative prognostic impact of neoplastic involvement in the posterior portion of the lower paraplegic space, which we call the "tireo-cricoaritenoid space" (TCAS).We have retrospectively considered the prognostic significance of TCAS involvement in a cohort of 84 patients treated with partial horizontal laringectomy open for glottal squamous cell carcinoma.

src: Cases with TCAS involvement experienced a higher recurrence rate and shorter disease-free survival. Neoplasms involving the TCAS should be considered and treated as extralaryngeal malignancies. Posterior glottic tumours with TCAS invasion have worse prognosis when managed with conservative surgery.
bt: Cases involving TCAS experienced a higher recurrence rate and a shorter free survival from the disease.TCAS-affected neoplasms should be considered and treated as extralaring malignancies.Post-glothial tumors with TCAS-invasive have a worse prognosis if managed with conservative surgery.

src: Total laryngectomy should be considered in cases of locally-advanced glottic carcinoma with TCAS involvement.
bt: Total laringectomy should be considered in cases of locally advanced glottal carcinoma involving TCAS.

src: In medical practice, during certain procedures that usually are not regarded highly demanding, some skill-based errors, that might not be considered as medical malpractice, may occur. In fact, such errors can be caused by factors beyond the physician’s control. A review of Greek case law regarding medical malpractice in otorhinolaryngology was performed to identify cases of lawsuits that concerned medical errors during routine procedures.
bt: In medical practice, during certain procedures that are usually not considered very demanding, certain skill-based errors may occur, which may not be considered medical negligence.In fact, such errors may be caused by factors outside the control of the physician.A revision of Greek jurisprudence regarding medical negligence in otorhinolaringoiatry has been carried out to identify cases of legal causes that involve medical errors during the routine procedure.

src: The analysis of the cases showed that some medical errors may cause serious complications, even if deviation from the standard of medical care is minimal. Thus, in some cases it may be difficult to make a distinction between preventable and unpreventable complications. Certain medical errors from routine medical procedures might be considered unpreventable and, therefore, classified as almost no-fault errors.
bt: Case studies have shown that some medical errors can cause serious complications, even if the deviation from the standard of medical care is minimal.Therefore, in some cases it can be difficult to distinguish between preventable and non-preventable complications.Some medical errors in routine medical procedures may be considered non-preventable and, therefore, classified as almost faultless errors.

src: A brief commentary regarding opportunities to further improve the medical liability system after the SARS-CoV-2 emergency is also given.
bt: I also provided a brief commentary on the opportunities to further improve the system of medical liability after the SARS-CoV-2 emergency.

src: Medical simulation enables trainees to learn procedural skills in a tailored, non-threatening, controlled environment that can provide feedback and educational experiences. The goals of this study are to describe the set-up and execution of an educational intervention (SimORL) in Ear Nose and Throat (ENT) simulation, to report confidence in performing basic ENT procedures before and after the event and investigate whether participants would find it useful and educationally effective. SimORL was a two-day formative event held at SIMNOVA - Eastern Piedmont Simulation Centre, Italy.
bt: The medical simulation allows trainees to acquire procedural competence in a personalized, controlled and non-threatening environment capable of providing feedback and educational experiences.The objectives of this study are to describe the setting and execution of an educational intervention (SimORL) in the simulation of the nose and throat of the ear (otorinolaringoiatry), restore confidence in the execution of basic otorinolaringoiatric procedures before and after the event, and investigate whether participants would find it useful and effective in education.

src: The event was open to ENT trainees from any Italian ENT training program; participants were divided into 5 teams and rotated around 10 different simulation stations over two days. Stations included: high-fidelity, skill trainer, computer based, wet lab and dissection. Stations were: virtual otoscopy
bt: The event was open to ENT trainees of any Italian ENT training program; participants were divided into 5 teams and rotated around 10 different simulation stations over two days.

src: The primary goal of the present study was to compare breathing difficulties resulting from OSAS to possible cognitive-behavioural problems of the child linked to their parents’ emotional-relational aspects. There is strong evidence that sleep breathing disorders are associated with behavioural alterations, a tendency towards aggressiveness, weak school performance and a clear disorder in continuous and selective attention other than vigilance status. Not all patients suffering from OSA have cognitive and/or behavioural manifestations; furthermore, the degree of dysfunction that the patient may present does not seem to be associated with the seriousness of sleep breathing disorder (SBD).
bt: The primary objective of this study was to confront the respiratory difficulties resulting from OSAS with possible cognitive-behavioral problems of the child related to the emotional-relational aspects of the parents.There is strong evidence that sleeping respiratory disorders are associated with behavioral alterations, a tendency to aggression, poor school performance and a clear disturbance in continuous and selective attention different from the state of vigilance.Not all patients with osteoarthritis have cognitive and/or behavioral manifestations; furthermore, the degree of dysfunction the patient may present does not seem to be associated with the severity of sleeping respiratory disorder (SBD).

src: It is therefore likely that genetic susceptibility associated with particular environmental factors has a role in determining phenotypic manifestations which are unique for every single patient. Questionnaires were given to parents, one regarding executive functions and one regarding parental stress: Conners’ Rating Scale Revised; Parenting Stress Index.
bt: It is therefore likely that genetic susceptibility associated with particular environmental factors may play a role in determining unique phenotypic manifestations for each individual patient.Parents were given questionnaires, one relating to executive functions and one relating to parental stress: Conners' Rating Scale Revised; Parental stress index.

src: All parents of children who suffer from moderate to severe OSA, with a McGill score of 3 to 4 and with no exclusion criteria are included in the study; behavioural and parental stress evaluation was made during hospitalisation and at 6 months after adenotonsillectomy. The results show that resolving OSAS led to important improvements in the competence and behavioural attitudes of the patient, as well as in relational and management difficulties by parents. The identification of such indicators could represent a support to surgical programming, even in non-severe SBD.
bt: All parents of children with moderate to severe OSA, with a McGill score of 3 to 4 and no exclusion criteria, were included in the study; the assessment of behavioral and parental stress was performed during the six-month recovery period following adeno-tonsillectomy.The results show that resolving OSAS led to significant improvements in patient skills and behavioral attitudes, as well as in the relational and managerial difficulties of parents.Identification of such indicators could represent support for surgical programming, even in the case of non-serious SBD.

src: Future research will have the goal of identifying standardised risk indicators that can provide further indications for surgical treatment in children up to 5 years of age.
bt: Future research will aim to identify standardized risk indicators that may provide additional indications for surgical treatment in children up to 5 years of age.

src: Congenital nasolacrimal duct cyst (NLDC) is a rare disorder, which can present with ophthalmological and nasal signs and symptoms. The authors analyse their personal experience to identify diagnostic criteria for NLDC, which were treated by endoscopic transnasal procedure. Clinical records of patients with a diagnosis of NLDC were retrospectively reviewed.
bt: Congenital nasolacrimal cataract cyst (NLDC) is a rare pathology, which can present with signs and symptoms of ophthalmology and nasal decay.The authors analyze their personal experience to identify diagnostic criteria for NLDC, which have been treated by transnasale endoscopic procedure.The clinical cartel of patients diagnosed with NLDC has been retrospectively examined.

src: All patients underwent rhinoscopy and ophthalmologist evaluation before surgery, whereas imaging was performed in selected cases. All neonates underwent transnasal endoscopic marsupialisation after failure of conservative medical therapy. Five patients were included in the study.
bt: All patients were subjected to rhinoscopy and ophthalmological evaluation prior to the procedure, while imaging was performed in select cases.All newborns were subjected to transnasal endoscopic marsupialization after the failure of conservative medical therapy.Five patients were included in the study.

src: One patient presented bilateral NLDC. In 3 cases, CT scan of the sinus was carried out. A total of 6 marsupialisation procedures were performed and a bi-canalicular lacrimal stent was positioned in 1 case.
bt: One patient presented bilateral NLDC.In three cases, a CT scan of the breast was performed.Today, a total of six marsupialization procedures were performed and in one case a bicanalicular tear stent was positioned.

src: Complete remission of symptoms was observed in all cases. Nasal endoscopy is mandatory to diagnose NLDCs, and, in some cases, it can be complemented by radiological procedures. When symptoms persist after systemic and topical therapy, nasal endoscopic marsupialisation is the treatment of choice.
bt: In all cases, complete remission of symptoms has been observed.Nasal endoscopy is mandatory for diagnosing NLDC and, in some cases, may be integrated into the radiological procedure.When symptoms persist after systemic and topical therapy, nasal endoscopic marsupialization is the treatment of choice.

src: This surgical procedure is effective, safe and can be repeated if needed.
bt: This surgical procedure is effective, safe and can be repeated if necessary.

src: Previous studies have highlighted that baseline Sinonasal Outcome Test 22 (SNOT-22) score affects surgical outcomes in chronic rhinosinusitis (CRS) and suggested that a SNOT-22-based approach might ameliorate patients’ understanding of expectations after treatment. Our study aimed at verifying this hypothesis in an Italian CRS population. In 457 CRS patients treated with endoscopic sinus surgery after failure of maximal medical therapy, the percentage of achieving a minimal clinically important difference (MCID) and the percentage of relative improvement after surgery were calculated.
bt: Previous studies have shown that the baseline score of Sinonasal Outcome Test 22 (SNOT-22) influences surgical outcomes in chronic rhinosinusite (CRS) and have suggested that a SNOT-22-based approach could improve patient expectations after treatment.Our study sought to test this hypothesis in an Italian CRS population.In 457 patients with CRS treated with endoscopic breast surgery after the failure of maximum medical therapy, the percentage of achievement of a clinically significant relative difference (MCID) and the percentage of improvement after surgery were calculated.

src: Moreover, the impact of several factors on preoperative and postoperative SNOT-22 score was investigated. Symptom improvement occurred in the majority of patients and was directly proportional to baseline SNOT-22. 79,7% of patients achieved the MCID and the percentage of relative improvement was 50,1%.
bt: In addition, the impact of various factors on pre-operative and postoperative SNOT-22 score has been studied, with improvement in symptoms seen in most patients directly proportional to basal SNOT-22, with 79.7% of patients achieving MCID and a relative improvement rate of 50.1%.

src: Psychological and social-functioning implications significantly affected SNOT-22 scores. Multiple regression analysis showed that history of previous surgery, asthma, preoperative endoscopic and SNOT-22 scores predicted the postoperative SNOT-22 score (R2 = 0,298). Submitting CRS patients to SNOT-22 prior to surgical treatments might help to inform about probable outcomes, although it is strongly influenced by individual perception.
bt: Multiple regression analysis has shown that the history of previous surgical interventions, asthma, preoperative endoscopic scores and SNOT-22 predicted the postoperative SNOT-22 score (R2 = 0.298).Putting patients with CRS to SNOT-22 before surgical treatments could help inform their likely outcomes, although it is strongly influenced by individual perception.

src: Further studies are needed to identify an effective set of subjective and objective parameters for evaluation of outcomes.
bt: Further studies are needed to identify an effective set of subjective and objective parameters for evaluating results.

src: The aim of this study was to evaluate the duration of estrus suppression after a double administration of the anti-GnRH vaccine Improvac® (Zoetis Schweiz GmbH, 2800 Delémont) in cows. Furthermore, it should be investigated, if a third administration could prolong the effect of the cycle suppression. A total of 21 cows (more than four weeks post partum) were vaccinated twice, at least 35 days apart, with 2 ml Improvac® (0.4 mg of a GnRH-analogon) subcutaneously on one side of the neck.
bt: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the duration of the suppression of the oestrogens after a double administration of the GnRH Improvac® vaccine (Zoetis Schweiz GmbH, 2800 Delémont) in cows, and to study whether a third administration could prolong the effect of the suppression of the cycle.A total of 21 cows (more than four weeks after birth) were vaccinated twice, at least 35 days apart, with 2 ml of Improvac® (0.4 mg of an GnRH analogue) via subcutaneous on one side of the neck.

src: Over a period of 368 days and in the course of 18 farm visits these cows were examined gynecologically and re-vaccinated if they showed signs of estrus behaviour or ovarian activity. After the second vaccination the cycle of the cows was suppressed for an average period of 114 days (59-175 days) and the effect could be prolonged by a booster of the vaccine for another 127 days in three cows. Estrus behaviour was absent for a longer period than ovarian activity was.
bt: During a 368-day period and during 18 farm visits, these cows were examined gynecologically and had signs of ovary activity or ovarian activity, and after the second vaccination the cycle of the cows was suspended for an average period of 114 days (59-175 days) and the effect could be prolonged by a recall of the vaccine for another 127 days in three cows.

src: The vaccine was tolerated well: apart from slight swelling at the injection site, no side effects were observed. Our results demonstrate that two immunizations with Improvac® are an easily applicable method for the suppression of cyclic activity in cows for a mean period of 114 days. The duration of cycle suppression was prolonged by a booster of the vaccination.
bt: The vaccine was well tolerated: partly a slight swelling at the injection site, no side effects were observed.Our results show that two vaccinations with Improvac® are an easily applicable method for suppressing cyclical activity in cows for an average period of 114 days.

src: This paper examines the question of why the pattern of narcissistic object-relating (collusion) develops early in life and how it may impact the lifelong process of individuation. Narcissistic adult couple relationships are one of the arenas in which unresolved aspects of the past, alive in the present, are unconsciously brought and endlessly repeated with intensity. Adult relationships are often formed in the hope that both partners will wipe out their old wounds.
bt: This article examines the question of why the model of narcissistic relationship with the object (collusion) develops early in life and how it can affect the lifelong process of individualization.Narcissistic relationships between adult couples are one of the arenas where unresolved aspects of the past, living in the present, are unconsciously carried on and repeated infinitely with intensity.Relationships between adults often form in the hope that both partners can heal their wounded neighbor.

src: However, despite apparent differences in overt social functioning, people unconsciously tend to select partners who are at the same basic level of personality differentiation, but who have opposite patterns of defensive organization. Primitive defences and projections, which are played out by the narcissistic couple, become a substitute for true identity. They can rigidify or disrupt the ego-Self axis rendering it inflexible.
bt: However, despite the apparent differences in social functioning, people tend to unconsciously select partners who are at the same basic level of personality differentiation, but who have opposite models of defensive organization.The primitive defenses and projections, implemented by the narcissistic couple, become a substitute for the true identity.They can irrigate or disrupt the ego-Self, making it inflexible.

src: These dynamics inhibit the ability of the ego to gain access to the unconscious, and the Self to get access to the ego, disrupting the possibility of emergence of a dialogical relationship. This process creates obstacles to growth and individuation, which leads this author to suggest the notion of 'impeded individuation' in narcissism.
bt: These dynamics inhibit the ego's ability to access the unconscious and the ego's ability to access the ego, disrupting the possibility of emerging from a dialogical relationship, creating barriers to growth and individuality, which led this author to suggest the notion of "individualisation impedita" in narcissism.

src: Polyarthritis caused by Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae is a well-known disease in pigs, and ovine erysipelas infection also commonly affects two-to-six month-old lambs. This report describes case histories of three sheep flocks where lambs exhibited swollen joints and lameness. Special emphasis was given to clinical and diagnostic imaging findings, synovia sampling and the treatment regime.
bt: Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae is a well-known disease in pigs and infection of the erysipelas commonly affects lambs between the ages of two and six months.This report describes the cases of three flock of sheep in which lambs had gonfie and zoppia joints. Particular attention has been paid to clinical and diagnostic results by image, sampling of synovia and treatment regimens.

src: Lambs with only mild lameness, liquid serofibrinous joint effusion and lambs showing no bone involvement, as revealed by ultrasonography or radiography, were treated with systemically administered antibiotics selected from results of antimicrobial susceptibility testing of E. rhusiopathiae isolated from synovial samples, and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. Lambs with severe lameness and severely swollen joints were euthanized, and routine necropsy was undertaken with a focus on the joints. Further, a herd-specific autogenous vaccine was produced by a specialized laboratory.
bt: Gli agnelli with mild zoppia, fluid, serofibrinous joint discharge and gli agnelli without bone-infecting, as evidenced by the ultrasound or radiography, were treated with systemic antibiotics, selected from the results of the tests of antimicrobial sensitivity of the E. rhusiopathiae isolated from test samples and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. Gli agnelli with severe zoppia and severely inflated joints were suppressed and routine autopsy was performed with attention to joints.

src: In conclusion, E. rhusiopathiae infection should be considered as a differential diagnosis in herds associated with lameness and polyarthritis in lambs aged between two up to 17 months.
bt: In conclusion, infection with E. rhusiopathiae should be considered as a differential diagnosis in the treatment of zoppia and polyarthritis in lambs aged between two and 17 months.
